subject: Re: [junit] JUnit4 and eclipse
msgSnippet: *This message was transferred with a trial version of CommuniGate(tm) Pro* Are you just using the built in eclipse test runner or ant?  As I recall, just
messageBody:
*This message was transferred with a trial version of CommuniGate(tm) Pro*

Are you just using the built in eclipse test runner or ant? As I
recall, just adding the junit v4 jar made it work in eclipse. You might
ckeck Windows->Preferences->Java->JUnit settings and make sure
everything is fine. You should see listings for JUnit 3 AND JUnit 4.
Make sure you check 'Enable Assertions for JUnit ..."

My problem was in running JUnit v4 from Ant. To do this, I had to
install Ant 1.7.x and update the ANT_HOME within Eclipse since it comes
with a built in Ant 1.6.x installation.

Robert Kuropkat

P.S. You may need to make sure you have all the latest Eclipse updates...


oferstu wrote:
> *This message was transferred with a trial version of CommuniGate(tm) Pro*
> Hello,
> The link in JUnit.org website about how to use JUnit and eclipse is
> broken.
> My attempt to use JUnit with eclipse was to add the JUnit.jre file to
> the project in properties, build path.
> I added it and still cannot run JUnit4 code.
> What else should I do in order that the JUnit4 will work with my
> eclipse?
>
> Thank you,
> Ofer.
